chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin J Olwig was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 1 Day, If Revoked.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation/Extended Supervision.

Cash Bail refunded to poster.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

To be paid as a Condition of Probation/Extended Supervision.

Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court and forwarded to the Village of Pewaukee Police Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of Probation.
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet previously done.

County #3 was Dismissed.

Last 60 days to be served through the Day Report Program/Center.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kevin J Olwig in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.

Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read-in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  3.5  Years
Initial Confinement:  1.5  Years
Extended Supervision:  2  Years
1 Day Credit
Stayed

If Revoked:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 


33 Months D/L REVOCATION
33 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Term of Probation:  2.5 Years
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to Village of Pewaukee Police Department);
Fine:  $1,519
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Last 60 days to be served through the Day Report Program.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
